lines.text: Current loop in magnetic field experiences torque
Calculating the magnetic field around a wire

secText:
Lesson:
1. Describe a [OBJ:pwsec_q762:velocity selector].
2. Describe the [OBJ:expsec_q763:motion of charged particles] in a magnetic field when the velocity of the charged particle is perpendicular to the magnetic field.
3. Apply the concept of circular motion of a charged particle in magnetic fields to [OBJ:pwsec_q764:mass spectrometers].
4. Work through a sample problem to [OBJ:app_cyclotron_motion_parameters_question:determine the effect of changing the radius of the path of a particle] in circular motion in a magnetic field.
5. Describe the [OBJ:expsec_q765:Hall effect].
6. [OBJ:expsec_q766:Describe] how Hall experimentally determined the Hall effect.
7. Define and calculate the [OBJ:expsec_q767:force] of a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field.
8. Describe the [OBJ:expsec_q768:torque] on a current-carrying loop in a magnetic field.
9. Define and calculate the [OBJ:expsec_q774:magnetic field] around a wire.
Quick Review: [OBJ:sum_magnet_current:Magnetic Fields and Electric Currents], [OBJ:sum_bfield_wire_equation:Magnetic Field Around a Wire]
